channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.description: America's west coast is set to have its hottest two weeks in 70 years, putting even more strain on power grids after California imposed its first rolling blackouts since 2001.
item.title: California begins rolling blackouts as state faces worst heat in 70 years

item.dc:creator: Anthony Colangelo
item.description: Carlton coach David Teague has acknowledged luck played a part in the Blues stunning after-the-siren win against Fremantle, although he wouldn't be drawn on the controversial down field free kick that led to Jack Newnes' winning set shot.
item.title: 'A little bit lucky': Teague hails Carlton's effort in thriller

item.description: She likes to cook, she likes to dance and she has already made an impact with record numbers of donations rolling in for Joe Biden's election campaign.
item.title: Kamala Harris bringing energy, dollars and more to Biden's campaign

item.description: Earlier this year, my beloved and I celebrated our 40th wedding anniversary, and if anyone were to ask the secret of our longevity, I reckon we’d say ‘tea’.
item.title: Faith column: Tea for two has kept our marriage strong for 40 years

item.dc:creator: The Herald's View
item.description: Healthcare workers not only have a right to work in a safe environment, but we need them to keep us alive too. Every infected healthcare worker cannot work once diagnosed, and their close-contact colleagues cannot work either for 14 days. Repeat that scenario too many times and all of a sudden we won’t have enough workers to keep our healthcare system running.
item.title: We must protect our healthcare workers

item.dc:creator: Wendy Tuohy
item.description: 'Health workers are uniquely bad at asking for help when they need it. It's sort of ingrained in the training: illness is something that happens to other people, not us', says Black Dog Institute's Dr Sam Harvey.
item.title: Not 'heroes' nor martyrs, doctors' mental health also needs support

item.dc:creator: Katina Curtis
item.description: A $500 million development of the Australian War Memorial has brought to the fore tensions over the institution's twin roles.
item.title: A battle for the nation's memory fought over Australian War Memorial

item.dc:creator: Greg Baum
item.description: “When I found myself, aged 14, alone in his house, I saw it as proof that I was special. I didn’t regard his first assault as rape," Alison Quigley recalls.
item.title: Decades on, Alison extracted a confession from her gymnastics coach

item.description: Icare is a metaphor for an arrogant government obsessed with outsourcing and privatisation.
item.title: For all icare: Perrottet blind to ethical failings

item.dc:creator: Sarah Keoghan
item.description: Thirteen-year-old Nikki Webster had kept her starring role in the Sydney Olympics opening ceremony a secret from her parents. Then they sat down to watch.
item.title: Nikki Webster 20 years on: How the opening ceremony changed everything

item.dc:creator: Bevan Shields
item.description: The Palace of Westminster is falling apart but the plan to save it is fantastically expensive, highly disruptive and increasingly polarising.
item.title: One of the world's most famous buildings might burn to the ground while you're sleeping

item.dc:creator: Wendy Tuohy
item.description: With women losing jobs faster than men, experts warn that without budgetary measures targeted at creating jobs for women many will be "scarred in the labor force" for years.
item.title: Calls for female-focused budget as women face financial 'gender disaster'

item.dc:creator: Danny Weidler
item.description: The wayward Brisbane star has engaged a lawyer as he looks to salvage his career at the club.
item.title: Pangai jnr irate over claims he blasted Broncos

item.dc:creator: Adrian Proszenko
item.description: A number of factors, including the new six-again rule, have contributed to the highest average winning margin in the NRL's history this season.
item.title: Blowouts reach highest point in NRL history

item.dc:creator: Fergus Hunter
item.description: The MPs warn the lack of virtual options to participate during COVID-19 makes Parliament less inclusive and deprives people of representation.
item.title: Pregnant MPs warn they are being shut out of inflexible Parliament

item.dc:creator: Angus Thompson
item.description: The NSW government sold land that was subject to claim by Indigenous Australians while keeping them in the dark in a practice the Aboriginal Land Council says has kept restitution out of reach.
item.title: Government sold land under claim by Aboriginal Australians

item.dc:creator: Carrie Fellner
item.description: The catchments which supply Sydney's tap water are under increasing pressure from blue-green algae, mining, climate change and bushfires.
item.title: Toxic threats to Sydney's drinking water catchments

item.dc:creator: Jenna Price
item.description: There are plenty of Australians whose incomes are unaffected, yet they have fewer things to spend their money on and they can't do it overseas.
item.title: Local galleries booming as art fiends open wallets in lockdown

item.dc:creator: Jordan Baker
item.description: Competition between the state's top schools is intensifying as parents of top students engage in "scholarship shopping".
item.title: Private system targets year 5 students to squeeze out selective schools

item.dc:creator: Fergus Hunter
item.description: Crossbench senators have outlined their demands as the government seeks to pass its radical changes to university funding.
item.title: 'Very serious concerns': Crossbench threat to government's uni fee overhaul

item.dc:creator: Nick Bonyhady
item.description: The High Court of Australia awarded entrepreneur Dr Benoy Berry $27 million after agents of a Reserve Bank-linked company perpetrated a "shabby fraud" against him.
item.title: Nigerian billionaire 'betrayed' when he agreed to sell a classic Aussie invention

item.dc:creator: Andrew Taylor
item.description: The hospitality industry fears pubs, clubs and restaurants will be shut down again if COVID-19 regulations are not strictly followed.
item.title: 'I wanna keep going out': Campaign urges young people to socialise responsibly

item.dc:creator: Caitlin Fitzsimmons
item.description: The Australian Border Force has granted permission for 22,640 citizens and permanent residents to depart Australia, out of 91,950 applications in total.
item.title: 'On par with North Korea': Three out of four requests to leave Australia refused

item.dc:creator: Andrew Taylor
item.description: The state government is seeking new ideas for Sydney's parks, public facilities and streets as COVID-19, climate change and population growth transform the city.
item.title: State government launches competition for Sydney's public spaces

item.dc:creator: Caitlin Fitzsimmons
item.description: It's like a gift registry or wishing well at a wedding but it's for funerals.
item.title: Tap 'n' go for funerals a sign of shifting norms

item.dc:creator: Rachel Clun
item.description: The dangers have been highlighted in a case of a young girl who drank sanitiser and was placed on a ventilator in intensive care.
item.title: 'Very dangerous': Calls about hand sanitiser poisonings more than double during pandemic

item.dc:creator: Peter FitzSimons
item.description: You could be forgiven for thinking the Deputy Premier was the Minister for Rugby League.
item.title: Does John Barilaro have ambitions to run the NRL?

item.dc:creator: Lucy Stone
item.description: When builder Brett Ivey realised his three favourite Gold Coast homes – all quite different – were designed by the same architect, he knew he'd found the man to design his home.
item.title: 'Forgotten old Gold Coast home' crowned Australian House of the Year

item.dc:creator: Andrew Taylor
item.description: COVID-19 has cast doubt on Sydney's New Year's Eve fireworks as NSW Tourism Minister expresses support for the event going ahead.
item.title: Clover Moore says it 'may not be responsible' to hold New Year's Eve fireworks

item.dc:creator: Nathanael Cooper
item.description: At the same time as he is preparing to release his debut studio album, Australian troubadour Tim Minchin is dealing with a private tragedy.
item.title: 'I'm just trying to get on with it': Tim Minchin on taking the good with the bad

item.dc:creator: Julia Naughton
item.description: The hairstyle, known for its business-on-top, party-at-the-back shape is emblematic of all things ‘80s style. But recently, it’s made some notable appearances.
item.title: Enter, the mud flap: The mullet is making a comeback

item.dc:creator: Peter Hannam
item.description: Environment Minister Matt Kean has rebuffed attempts by Nationals leader John Barilaro to halt the removal of feral horses from sensitive areas of the famous national park.
item.title: Kean vows to press on with horse removal from Kosciuszko National Park

item.dc:creator: Lucy Manly
item.description: Former rugby league WAG Phoebe Burgess is promoting the yet-to-be-built project to her Insta followers.
item.title: Mummy influencers spruik eastern suburbs childcare

item.dc:creator: Sophie Aubrey
item.description: Kate Nelson has spent 10 years avoiding plastic, but even she has found her fiercely sustainable lifestyle confronted by the pandemic.
item.title: 'Go topless': As household waste soars, here's what you can do

item.dc:creator: Andrew Hornery
item.description: After James Murdoch's public departure from family affairs, the heir apparent is clearer than ever. So who exactly is Lachlan Keith Murdoch and what makes him tick?
item.title: Murdoch empire will continue its reign under Lachlan

item.dc:creator: Vince Rugari
item.description: Angus Chance took a stand against racism and copped a punch to the jaw. Then his teammates were allegedly told not to contact him for more than a month as he recovered.
item.title: 'It should never have come to this': Punched for rebuking racism, a young player takes Football NSW to court

item.dc:creator: Tom Cowie
item.description: Recreating the pub experience at home during the COVID-19 pandemic hasn’t only been limited to getting tap beer and chicken parmigiana delivered to the door. Trivia nights have also gone online to provide the entertainment.
item.title: Online pub quizzes a not-so-trivial isolation pursuit

item.dc:creator: Tom Cowie
item.description: The closing down of the economy in the past few months has forced many businesses to come up with new ways to get rid of extra stock. For Phil, it was footballs.
item.title: Red leather day: Sherrin a bargain for locked-up footy fans

item.dc:creator: Adam Carey
item.description: Some of the state’s wealthiest non-government schools are tapping into JobKeeper to pay staff salaries amid the economic gloom of Victoria’s COVID-19 lockdown.
item.title: More high-fee independent schools tap into JobKeeper as recession bites

item.dc:creator: Chris Vedelago
item.description: Confidential documents show police at one point formulated the theory that Melbourne’s “lobster mobster”, fruiterer and businessman Tony Madafferi, might have ordered the hit on gangland lawyer Mario Condello.
item.title: Police alleged Madafferi ordered Brighton hit on underworld money man

item.dc:creator: Liam Mannix
item.description: A coalition of medical groups is demanding the state government urgently ensure doctors and nurses access to properly fitted masks, as healthcare worker infections spiral.
item.title: Medicos concerned about ill-fitting masks as infections spiral

item.dc:creator: Jacqueline Maley
item.description: We need our governments now - and we need them to be honest with us.
item.title: The Morrison government owes us radical transparency

item.dc:creator: Sarah Danckert
item.description: Literally operating under ASIC's nose in Melbourne, iProsperity and its boss Michael Gu made claims to have purchased big name hotels and malls - but many of the deals were allegedly not what they seemed.
item.title: 'New Christopher Skase' had extensive investments in Melbourne

item.description: Bipartisanship will come to nothing if governments are not prepared to provide basic information and answers for a public that deserves access to the facts.
item.title: Aren't we supposed to all be in this together?

item.dc:creator: Helen Pitt
item.description: We owe a much better existence to the occupants of aged care facilities, yet many of them carry on with humour and grace and compassion for their fellow residents.
item.title: COVID lessons from the survivors of other horrors

item.dc:creator: Dave Sharma
item.description: The Palestinians should welcome this deal as it makes a two-state solution more likely.
item.title: UAE deal gives Israel long overdue legitimacy

item.dc:creator: Anthony Colangelo
item.description: Jack Newnes kicked an after-the-siren goal from the 50-metre line, on the boundary, sparking delirium for the Blues players on the field after they ground their way back into the game.
item.title: Blue heavens: Newnes rescues Carlton from defeat after final siren

item.dc:creator: Jake Niall
item.description: There's little point in Hawthorn persisting in playing Shaun Burgoyne over the final rounds of what should be his final season in brown and gold.
item.title: Burgoyne's chance to go out in Silky style

item.dc:creator: Jessica Irvine
item.description: For many service providers, you would be surprised at the discounts available for existing clients if you simply ask.
item.title: Why you should 'hit it or quit it' when it comes to your bills

item.dc:creator: Ronny Lerner
item.description: A huge Saturday of AFL action saw Carlton beat Fremantle after the siren, Melbourne thrash Collingwood and the Brisbane Lions pip North Melbourne by a point.
item.title: As it happened: Carlton Blues beat Fremantle Dockers after the siren, Melbourne Demons thrash Collingwood Magpies, Brisbane Lions pip North Melbourne Kangaroos
